page.title: 05WORKING ON A DAIRY FARM.
page.content: Joanne Fosters dad is a dairy farmer and he gets up about five o'clock in the morning. He milks the friesian cows and sends the milk off. He feeds the cows on cake and kale as well as hay and silage. Mr Foster and his friend Andrew start milking at 6 a.m. They go to the fields to gather the cows up and drive them into the milking parlour. At 7 a.m. a tanker comes from Wellington to collect the milk and then it goes to other farms. After he has milked the cows he has to clean the parlour out. Then he takes all of the cows out and puts them back into the field. He puts all of the electric fences on so the cows won't escape and then he makes sure that the grass is all right to eat. He also has to milk the cows again in the evening. Each cow gives 6 litres of milk at a time.
